intro: Ornithopus roseus f. albiflorus, commonly known as the white-flowered sweet rocket, is a cultivar of the annual flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features striking white flowers that contrast with its gray-green, fern-like foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 12 to 18 inches and blooms from late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value lies in its delicate, lace-like appearance and long-lasting blooms.
